Extra Resources

Resources

Math / Minerals / Structures

Math

Unit conversions

  • The Math You Need: This has a set of worked examples that you can try. It hides the step-by-step solution from you so you can try it on your own, and when you're ready to check you work, you can reveal the answer. After that, it has a section called "Next Steps" with a link to an assessment---but don't do that; instead, you can try the worksheets linked in the "Still Need Practice?" section.
  • Dimensional Analysis: Nice video walkthrough and some practice with unit conversions from Khan Academy.
  • Interpreting Units: More Khan Academy, this time about matching up a formula (such as œÅ = m/V) with the approprate units (g/cm^3).

Statsy Stuff

  • Mean, Median, Mode: Conceptual overview from Crash Course Statistics. Their videos are outrageously helpful and actually fun to watch! I promise!
  • Measures of Spread: More Crash Course Statistics! This video includes quartile ranges, variance, and standard deviation.
  • How to Calculate the Standard Deviation: Step-by-step article from Khan Academy.

Minerals
  • Mindat: Properties and lots of pix.
  • NPS Minerals: Basic info; a nice starting point.
  • Mineral ID key: From the Mineralogical Society of America.

Structures
  • Visible Geology:3D geologic maps! Drag and rotate and do all kinds of good stuff!
  • OCW Structural: Lots of lecture slides and stuff from an MIT course.
  • The Montana Geoheritage Project: Neat local structures!
